name: Next JS
description: A fullstack framework for React with SSR and SSG that provides built-in optimizations.

name: React
description: The world's most popular non-opinionated frontend UI framework. Focuses on functional UI.

name: NodeJS
description: The first ever server-side JavaScript runtime built on Google Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.

name: TypeScript
description: A better version of JavaScript that privides static typing to the language,

name: Deno
description: The successor to NodeJS built with Rust and focused on TypeScript, efficiency, and simplicity.

name: SCSS
description: A better version of CSS that provides support for nested selectors, functions, mixins and so much more.

name: Express
description: The most popular NodeJS library for http servers that allows for JavaScript based APIs and web apps.

name: Docker
description: Containerization for apps that gives standardization and recreation abilities to reduce "it works on my machine" problems.

name: Fresh
description: A brand-new React framework built and used with Deno (used to create this site)

name: Figma
description: Frontend UI design tool for team-based web design and optimized collaboration.

name: Vercel
description: Serverless hosting for web apps like NextJS, React, Angular, Vite, etc. (creators of Next JS).

name: MongoDB
description: Extremely popular NoSQL database.

name: Heroku
description: Cloud hosting for applications.

name: Netlify
description: Hosting service for static web apps.

name: JavaScript
description: The most popular coding language of today; powers the web, keeps sites functioning.

name: CSS
description: The universal frontend styling language.

name: Webpack
description: JavaScript module bundler/builder.

name: LWC
description: Salesforce's frontend framework (Lightning Web Components).

name: Angular
description: A popular, opinionated frontend UI framework created by Google.

name: Vite
description: The better, faster, newer version of Webpack (uses HMR).

name: Lit
description: Abstraction framework for WebComponents.

name: Ionic
description: Fullstack framework for building applications.

name: Prisma
description: A TypeScript-based ORM (abstraction layer) for SQL database management.

name: Electron
description: Creates desktop apps with HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
